mdRecord.dcterms:title: Museum - Case #7
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Exhibit case in the museum displaying several lacquer dressing boxes, cordial glasses, SÃ¨vres porcelain, Martha Washington's fan [W-610] and a shell cushion embroidered by Martha Washington amongst other items. The Museum (1928-2006) was built along the north lane between the spinning house and the greenhouse slave quarters in 1928. It replaced the Relic House which occupied the nearby salt house from 1923-1928. When the Donald W. Reynolds Museum, built underground, opened in 2006, the space was repurposed as the Interpretive Center.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Mount Vernon Black and White Film Collection
